ratings.comment: Jess Gilbert's CE SOC 230 class had many dry readings that were hard not to fall asleep while you were reading them.  Lectures, however, were engaging and covered a broad range of ideas.  Reading the materials is recommended but not necessary.  Easy to get an A or AB.  Only 2 tests and 1 lecture. No final!!

Tremendous professor! It was incredibly refreshing to have taken this course with Dr. Gilbert. He is truly passionate about the subject and makes this topic fun to learn about. Furthermore, he lectures exactly what will be on the test, and he is truly inspirational to listen to!

Great professor! Really nice guy. He can go off on tangents, sometimes, but they are usually interesting stories. The class is interesting, too. You do have to write a 5-page paper. There is a decent amount of reading, but it's not too bad.

Very knowledgeable and straight forward. Jess has a way with teaching undergrads and making agricultural history to seem less boring. Lecture is a tad bit misorganized at times, but excellent overall. Discussion is mandatory but good for review and group input. 1 paper to do-not that big of a deal, reading is sometimes boring, sometimes not.

Great professor! He is very straight forward and wants everyone to do well in the class. Go to lecture, he tells you what's important in the readings and exactly what to study for the exams.  I definitely recommend this class!
I love Jess. I could listen to his puns for hours. He clearly knows what he's talking about, is very direct, and wants you to do well. He is on your side.
Great Professor!  Really knows his stuff. Lectures sum up exactly what is on test.  He is one of those guys that you wish was your dad. Super helpful.
They don't make professors better than Jess Gilbert.  He's an incredibly skilled, extremely gifted teacher who knows his stuff!  The BEST!
Jess is one of the best profs I've had (I'm a junior). He makes history come alive. Take this class!
